com.intel.fightclub.dialog.coach

Class SensorAPIHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.fightclub.dialog.coach.SensorAPIHelper

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class SensorAPIHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Convenience class for all CUI sensor related queries. This class is non-instantiable and should only be used through it's public static API.

    • Method Detail

      • relevantStreamsMissingForActivity

        @NonNull
 @CheckResult
public static java.util.Set<DialogSensor> relevantStreamsMissingForActivity(@NonNull
                                                                                                   android.content.Context context,
                                                                                                   @NonNull
                                                                                                   ActivityCui activityCui)
        Convenience method to determine relevant streams that are not streaming data for a given ActivityCui. This method will look at required data streams for the activity and evaluate if there's any of the streams that has not reported any information yet. Additionally, it will also checked user-selected streams, also referred to as preferred streams. For any data streams that are missing, this method will yield matching DialogSensor elements, which ultimately is what the user cares about per our UX design.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        activityCui - The activity for which we want to know if there's missing sensors.
        Returns:
        Empty if no sensors are missing, a non-empty set of DialogSensor elements if any are missing.

      • getPreferredDataStreams

        @NonNull
public static java.util.Map<DialogSensor,SensorStatus> getPreferredDataStreams(@NonNull
                                                                                        android.content.Context context,
                                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                                        ActivityCui activity)
        Retrieves preferred data streams from user-selected sensors. In addition to retrieving the streams, this method returns the current status of each stream. If the user has any sensor selected that does not apply to the given activity, it will be intentionally ignored.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        activity - Activity used to retrieve the proper DialogSensor from a data stream.
        Returns:
        A map containing preferred data streams in the form of DialogSensor elements, as well as the SensorStatus for each stream.

      • getStreamStatus

        @NonNull
public static SensorStatus getStreamStatus(@NonNull
                                                    android.content.Context context,
                                                    @NonNull
                                                    DialogSensor sensor)
        Gets the connection status of a given stream, exercising getLatestSensorDataPoint(Context, DataTypes, Integer...). Since the search is done based on data types, the user can determine whether to check whether we can actually get data from ARDA if a given data type is reported as missing. This is because not all streams supported by dialogue will be actually coming from sensors, some might get generated by ARDA, like power for instance. This will prevent things like: - "What is my power" - System: Power is 10 watts. - "Is my power data stream active?" - System: I'm not getting power data.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context, used to get the latest datapoints and WearableState
        sensor - The sensor for which we want to know the status.
        Returns:
        A SensorStatus for the given sensor.

      • isSensorConnectedToWearable

        public static boolean isSensorConnectedToWearable(@NonNull
                                                  android.content.Context context,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  SensorType sensorType)
        Determines if a sensor of a given type is currently connected, using WearableState. This should only be used to determine if the sensor is physically connected to the wearable (without checking any processing in-between), not if the data streams for that data type are providing any valid data.
        To determine e.g. UI status for a sensor, the data streams for data types are usually checked as well. If your intent is to determine sensor connection according to our UX and business logic, use getStreamStatus(android.content.Context, com.intel.fightclub.dialog.queries.model.DialogSensor) methods instead, as they have more extensive logic other than just raw connection status.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        sensorType - Sensor type to check connection status.
        Returns:
        True if the sensor is currently connected.

      • getStreamStatus

        @NonNull
public static SensorStatus getStreamStatus(@NonNull
                                                    android.content.Context context,
                                                    @NonNull
                                                    DialogSensor sensor,
                                                    boolean checkArdaStreams,
                                                    boolean onlyExternalSources)
        Gets the connection status of a given stream, exercising getLatestSensorDataPoint(Context, DataTypes, Integer...). Since the search is done based on data types, the user can determine whether to check whether we can actually get data from ARDA if a given data type is reported as missing. This is because not all streams supported by dialogue will be actually coming from sensors, some might get generated by ARDA, like power for instance. This will prevent things like: - "What is my power" - System: Power is 10 watts. - "Is my power data stream active?" - System: I'm not getting power data.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context, used to get the latest datapoints and WearableState
        sensor - The sensor for which we want to know the status.
        checkArdaStreams - True if ARDA should also be considered when checking stream status.
        onlyExternalSources - True if we should check only external data sources
        Returns:
        A SensorStatus for the given sensor.

      • getSpeedKilometersPerHour

        @NonNull
 @CheckResult
public static CUIResultBundle<java.lang.Double> getSpeedKilometersPerHour(@NonNull
                                                                                                 android.content.Context context,
                                                                                                 @Nullable
                                                                                                 ActivityType activityType,
                                                                                                 boolean onlyExternal)
        Gets speed in kilometers per hour. This method should be used when trying to access cached stride length data. If attempting to retrieve data during an active workout, you should use ArdaAPIHelper.getSpeedKilometersPerHour(WorkoutStateMetrics) instead.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        activityType - The type of the current workout.
        Returns:
        A CUIResultBundle containing the speed value or a ResultCode indicating the problem that prevented getting a result otherwise.

        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        Returns:
        A CUIResultBundle containing the pace value or a ResultCode indicating the problem that prevented getting a result otherwise.
